humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report provides a measurement of the largest tumor size, which is 40 mm (4 cm) in maximum gross dimension. According to the rules provided, T2 tumors are more than 2 cm but not more than 5 cm. Therefore, the pathologic T stage of the patient's cancer is T2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage of a cancer is determined by the size of the primary tumor. In this pathology report, the size of the invasive component of the tumor is measured to be 40 mm (4 cm) in maximum gross dimension. According to the TNM staging system for cancer, a T2 stage is given to tumors that are larger than 20 mm but no larger than 50 mm in size. Therefore, the T stage for this patient's cancer is T2.
